November 26, 2024 - Amazon offers multiple lines of privately labeled products. These are available on Amazon.com, Amazon Fresh, Prime Pantry, Prime Now, Amazon Go, and Whole Foods Market. Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.

t: How to know if the brands you're seeing on Amazon are going to be authentic when delivered - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 7): Anything you buy on Amazon is guaranteed by Amazon. But, look out for tech stuff that is pre-owned, refurbished or renewed by an Amazon-qualified supplier ...basically used but repaired. t: Here's One Way To Tell If An Amazon Product Is Counterfeit
s: March 2, 2018 - It’s easy for counterfeiters to swoop in on a company’s legitimate Amazon product listing and take over the “Buy” button.

2 days ago - Amazon sells many products under its own brand names, including phone chargers, batteries, and diaper wipes. The AmazonBasics brand was introduced in 2009, and now features hundreds of product lines, including smartphone cases, computer mice, batteries, dumbbells, and dog crates.

t: How Amazon Steers Shoppers to Its Own Products - The New York Times
s: June 25, 2018 - The company now has roughly 100 private label brands for sale, but few of those are sold under the Amazon brand.

t: This browser extension shows how many brands on Amazon are actually just Amazon | The Verge
s: November 30, 2021 - Amazon’s Basics and Essentials brands are well known, but some of its other private labels may not be so recognizable. The Amazon Brand Detector browser extension works to make it easier to tell who you’re buying from.
